abstract: Canon’s newly announced digital SLR, the 50D, is a hot-rod sibling of the year-old 40D. The parts under the hood have been replaced with higher-horsepower components.
snippet: Canon’s newly announced digital SLR, the 50D, is a hot-rod sibling of the year-old 40D. The parts under the hood have been replaced with higher-horsepower components.
lead_paragraph: Canon’s newly announced digital SLR, the 50D (approximately $1,400, body only), will be in stores in October and is a hot-rod sibling of the year-old 40D. It’s not just a cosmetic makeover. The 50D looks, feels and weighs the same, but the parts under the hood have been replaced with higher-horsepower components.

headline.main: An Upgraded Camera That Only Looks Familiar
headline.print_headline: An Upgraded Camera That Only Looks Familiar
